questions.question: An artificial horizon utilizes (i)............ to show (ii)........ in (iii)....... and (iv)..............
options: a. (i) an earth gyro (ii) position (iii) latitude (iv) longitude
b. (i) a space gyro (ii) attitude (iii) degrees (iv) minutes
c. (i) an earth gyro (ii) latitude (iii) pitch (iv) roll
d. (i) an earth gyro (ii) attitude (iii) pitch (iv) roll

questions.question: During the take-off run an air driven artificial horizon will usually indicate:
options: a. nose up and incorrect left bank
b. a false descending turn to the right
c. increased nose-up attitude and right wing low
d. a false climbing turn to the left

questions.question: The indication on the right shows:
options: a. a climbing turn to the right
b. nose up and left wing down
c. $30^{\circ}$ starboard bank, nose up
d. $30^{\circ}$ port bank, nose below horizon

questions.question: False nose-up attitude displayed on air driven artificial horizon during the take-off run is caused by:
options: a. the high pendulosity of the rotor
b. the lag of the lateral pendulous vanes
c. the linear acceleration cut-out
d. incorrect rotor speed

questions.question: The rotor axis of an electrical horizon is tied to the earth's vertical by:
options: a. four pendulous vanes
b. the roll cut-out
c. the low centre of gravity of the rotor housing
d. two mercury level switches and two torque motors

questions.question: False right wing low attitude shown on an air driven artificial horizon during an acceleration is caused by:
options: a. the lag of the base of the rotor housing
b. the logitudinal pendulous vanes
c. the roll cut-out
d. high rotor speed

questions.question: Inside an artificial horizon:
options: a. the inner gimbal ring is pivoted laterally inside the outer gimbal ring and the outer gimbal ring is pivoted longitudinally inside the case
b. the inner gimbal ring is tied to the vertical by a control system
c. the rotor axis is kept level by a calibrated spring attached to the outer gimbal ring and the instrument case
d. there is only one gimbal ring

questions.question: When an adjustable aircraft datum is fitted to an artificial horizon in light aircraft:
options: a. it should be checked at regular intervals
b. it should be set to the central position and left there
c. it should be rendered inoperative
d. it should be set to $15^{\circ}$

questions.question: An electrically driven artificial horizon has less errors during the take-off run because:
options: a. it is less pendulous, has a higher rotor speed and a linear acceleration cut-out
b. the mercury level switches are more sensitive than the pendulous vanes fitted to air driven types
c. the roll cut-out speed is activated
d. it is less aperiodic than the air driven types
